author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
I wonder if the name is maybe a little bit too general. Iâ€™d be open to `CartographyCRS`

[noblock]

It is not, this package is supposed to be general. It supersedes all projects for cartography in Julia and other languages.

[noblock]

>  It supersedes all projects for cartography in Julia and other languages.

It seems to only handle coordinate conversion, not other aspects of cartography...

Remember this is v0.1.0... The development just got started...

Also, cartography is pretty much CRS conversion. Anything else is geometric
processing on top of these conversions.

[noblock]

Em sex., 22 de mar. de 2024 02:48, Alexander Plavin <
***@***.***> escreveu:

> It supersedes all projects for cartography in Julia and other languages.
>
> It seems to only handle coordinate conversion, not other aspects of
> cartography...
>
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/103364#issuecomment-2014403129>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAZQW3KEBYY6BSCF7L4LJSLYZPA3HAVCNFSM6AAAAABFCDPPPWVHI2DSMVQWIX3LMV43OSLTON2WKQ3PNVWWK3TUHMZDAMJUGQYDGMJSHE>
> .
> You are receiving this because you commented.Message ID:
> ***@***.***>
>

It really depends on how you interpret the word cartography. If you see it
as the art of making maps as in mathematical maps, then it is all about CRS
conversions. If maps are interpreted as something more artistic with
austhetics choices etc, then it has other features that we plan to develop
in other packages.

We will think about the home of these planned features, and get back here
by the end of the day with an update.

[noblock]

Em sex., 22 de mar. de 2024 03:12, JÃºlio Hoffimann <
***@***.***> escreveu:

> Remember this is v0.1.0... The development just got started...
>
> Also, cartography is pretty much CRS conversion. Anything else is
> geometric processing on top of these conversions.
>
> [noblock]
>
> Em sex., 22 de mar. de 2024 02:48, Alexander Plavin <
> ***@***.***> escreveu:
>
>> It supersedes all projects for cartography in Julia and other languages.
>>
>> It seems to only handle coordinate conversion, not other aspects of
>> cartography...
>>
>> â€”
>> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
>> <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/103364#issuecomment-2014403129>,
>> or unsubscribe
>> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAZQW3KEBYY6BSCF7L4LJSLYZPA3HAVCNFSM6AAAAABFCDPPPWVHI2DSMVQWIX3LMV43OSLTON2WKQ3PNVWWK3TUHMZDAMJUGQYDGMJSHE>
>> .
>> You are receiving this because you commented.Message ID:
>> ***@***.***>
>>
>

After intense brainstorming, we came up with a shorter name that we liked: Spot.jl

![image](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/assets/3345261/80bfeb51-4831-4777-a0a4-6d76a4c71a9b)

Definition 2.

Are you both fine with this new name @goerz @aplavin ?

[noblock]

I could live with it, although I'd definitely prefer the more descriptive name. `Spot` also doesn't match the required minimum package name length, so you'll have to convince a full maintainer to merge it. If this is going to be a very comprehensive package, I'm still okay with `Cartography`, or else `Cartography<Something>` like `CartographyCRS`. I'd *definitely* be okay with `CartographySpots` (I think that would be a great name, in fact)

[noblock]

I believe that other packages already exist with the same name length. We prefer Spot.jl if possible, otherwise we fallback to Cartography.jl, which is also fine.

[noblock]

> I believe that other packages already exist with the same name length.

Sure! They just need to be merged manually, and of course, they get subjected to a lot more scrutiny than packages that just sail though the automatic merging.

> We prefer Spot.jl if possible

Not up to me (I don't have merge permissions). I'm not very enthusiastic about that name, but I'm fine with if you want it. Obviously, I can't speak for anyone else who might object if you try to register `Spot.jl`.

[noblock]

We discussed it internally again, and Cartography.jl is the winner. Let's just wait for the PR to get merged after the waiting period. Spot.jl is a nice short name, but it is not necessarily related to what we are trying to do in the package.

Cartography.jl it is ðŸ‘ðŸ½ 

[noblock]

[noblock]

> Let's just wait for the PR to get merged

I suppose we'll have to see if @aplavin found the argument for `Cartography` convincing enough to unblock the registration. Otherwise, you'll have to ask on Slack after the three-day period for a maintainer to merge manually.

I'm not a maintainer here and don't directly influence registration decisions, so feel free to proceed in whatever way appears reasonable.

The reason I opened this registration link is because I thought it's a package for making (ie drawing/plotting) maps of the earth, or some of its regions, or of arbitrary bodies. And got interested in that :)
If this package only provides conversions, wouldn't it make more sense to name CartographyConversions or something?..

Especially this sentence

> It supersedes all projects for cartography in Julia and other languages.

sounds way to strong for me, given projects like cartopy with a wider scope.
@aplavin what about CoordRefSystems.jl? That is another name that removes the "plotting/drawing" semantic completely.

Yeah, that sounds like a very descriptive name!
Maybe in the future some reuse (of code or ideas) would be useful between these and https://github.com/JuliaAstro/SkyCoords.jl â€“ that package defines main astronomical coordinate systems.
Sounds good! Please feel free to close this PR. We will rename it to CoordRefSystems.jl

> We will rename it to CoordRefSystems.jl

That's fine by me, although I think it's actually slightly less descriptive than other "nicer" names that keep the `Cartography` as a prefix, like `CartographyCoords`, `CartographyCRS`, `CartographySpots`, etc.

Totally up to you!

body:
- Registering package: Cartography
- Repository: https://github.com/JuliaEarth/Cartography.jl
- Created by: @eliascarv
- Version: v0.1.0
- Commit: 1403a02de5194b06ca50d97fd71303a0ff6feb3f
- Reviewed by: @eliascarv
- Reference: https://github.com/JuliaEarth/Cartography.jl/commit/1403a02de5194b06ca50d97fd71303a0ff6feb3f#commitcomment-140088701
- Description: Unitful coordinate reference systems for geographic maps in Julia
<!--  -->
title: New package: Cartography v0.1.0
